publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-5977Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Mr Frank McAveety*

S3M-5977 Rob Gibson: Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises—That the Parliament notes the recent Ipsos MORI poll that detailed that public awareness of social enterprises in Scotland had risen by 11% in just six months and now shows that 65% of Scots surveyed knew about social enterprises, up from 54% when the same question was polled in August 2009; recognises the role that the Scottish Social Enterprise Coalition has played in promoting the positive impact and crucial role that social enterprise businesses can play in their local areas, and congratulates it on its achievements in advocating the benefit of the social enterprise model. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Mr Frank McAveety, Michael Matheson*

S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Hugh Henry*, Mary Scanlon*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Christina McKelvie*, Robin Harper*, Andrew Welsh*, Aileen Campbell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Stuart McMillan*, Alasdair Allan*, Linda Fabiani*, Bill Kidd*, Bill Wilson*, Liam McArthur*, Christine Grahame*, Sandra White*, Bob Doris*
S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Jamie Stone*, Ken Macintosh*, Dave Thompson*
S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Maureen Watt*
S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) David Stewart*
S3M-5977 Recognising the Benefit of Social Enterprises (lodged on 16 March 2010) Gil Paterson*
